channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: '50' speed limit signs both sides sprayed with grey spray paint., 11th October
item.description:
After Stollards Close going out of Bishops Cleeve. They were sprayed during recent roadworks but have forgotten to be reinstated afterwards.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 255;257, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 255;257, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Moon crater of a pothole., 11th October
item.description:
This is a massive pothole. I hit it this morning and it shook my car to s****. I will need to get the wheels, tyres and suspension checked now. It was one hell of a jolt at 25mph in the morning rush hour. Needs fixing asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kew Place, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Priority Sign wording has been reversed, 11th October
item.description:
Approaching chicane from Gotherington to Bishop Cleeve down near new sports facility (i e. Southbound on Cleeve Lane the priority sign wording has been reversed. It should have " give way to oncoming vehicles" instead reads reverse wording " priority over oncoming vehicles" A dangerous mistake with traffic pulling out on to the opposite carriageway giving rise to near misses with northbound traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 inch wide by apos 2 inch high, two of them, 11th October
item.description:
Tree roots bulging out of the pavement between no 12-14 The Grove. Roots are getting bigger and pose a danger to pedestrians/pram pushers (old and young). The roots have gotten bigger over the last couple of months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, The Grove, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Overhanging DEAD branch with main telephone thick wire hanging on top of it, It is going to break off soon and could drop on a passerby or cause a terible car accident if it falls on roof of a car or thru windscreen, 11th October
item.description:
The tree is outside house 142 old bath road i think it is a lime tree. the owners of the house are elder couple - the gentleman is almost 90 and they are both very very worried about the situation. please fix it ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 142, Old Bath Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 11th October
item.description:
Emails received 10/10/2024 - copies attached. Customer reports that one of the concrete bollards at the location has been knocked over by a recycling lorry. It has been rolled out of the way for safety reasons and is currently O/S 35 and 36b Buckles Close. Please can Highways remove/replace this asap.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several drains down Gloucester rd are blocked/not functioning, 11th October
item.description:
Several drains down Gloucetser Rd are not working properly. This has resulted in localised flooding in the past couple of weeks, several times the road was closed off to prevent properties from flooding. Members of the public who live in this area are having to manage the situation themselves including traffic control, DIY unblocking the drains and clearing the drains out with their hands.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

pothole on side of drain , very sharp edges

item.title: Abandoned road/footpath signage, 11th October
item.description:
A number of "pedestrian route closed" signs have been left/abandoned outside No 135 and opposite,after last works were completed, and have been used for fun by kids, possibly being dangerous when left in the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Very badly damaged road surface over a large area, 11th October
item.description:
Very badly damaged road surface over a large area and in numerous places, making it hard to avoid as you pass through. This is a very busy thoroughfare, the damage has been there for a long time and it's getting worse. Resurfacing needed in the section between Idsall Drive and Southam Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
